org.apache.spark.sql.hive.execution

Class HiveComparisonTest

  • Object
    • org.scalatest.FunSuite
      • org.apache.spark.sql.hive.execution.HiveComparisonTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.typesafe.scalalogging.slf4j.Logging
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BigDataBenchmarkSuite, CachedTableSuite, HiveQueryFileTest, HiveQuerySuite, HiveResolutionSuite, HiveSerDeSuite, HiveTypeCoercionSuite, PruningSuite

    public abstract class HiveComparisonTest
extends org.scalatest.FunSuite
implements com.typesafe.scalalogging.slf4j.Logging
    Allows the creations of tests that execute the same query against both hive and catalyst, comparing the results.

    The "golden" results from Hive are cached in an retrieved both from the classpath and answerCache to speed up testing.

    See the documentation of public vals in this class for information on how test execution can be configured using system properties.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HiveComparisonTest

        public HiveComparisonTest()

    • Method Detail

      • recomputeCache

        public boolean recomputeCache()
        When set, any cache files that result in test failures will be deleted. Used when the test harness or hive have been updated thus requiring new golden answers to be computed for some tests. Also prevents the classpath being used when looking for golden answers as these are usually stale.

      • shardInfo

        public scala.Option<scala.Tuple2<Object,Object>> shardInfo()
        Allows multiple JVMs to be run in parallel, each responsible for portion of all test cases. Format shardId:numShards. Shard ids should be zero indexed. E.g. -Dspark.hive.testshard=0:4.

      • skipDirectories

        public scala.collection.Seq<java.io.File> skipDirectories()
        When set, this comma separated list is defines directories that contain the names of test cases that should be skipped.

        For example when -Dspark.hive.skiptests=passed,hiveFailed is specified and test cases listed in passedDirectory or hiveFailedDirectory will be skipped.

      • runOnlyDirectories

        public scala.collection.Seq<java.io.File> runOnlyDirectories()

      • passedDirectory

        public java.io.File passedDirectory()
        Directory containing a file for each test case that passes.

      • failedDirectory

        public java.io.File failedDirectory()
        Directory containing output of tests that fail to execute with Catalyst.

      • wrongDirectory

        public java.io.File wrongDirectory()
        Directory containing output of tests where catalyst produces the wrong answer.

      • hiveFailedDirectory

        public java.io.File hiveFailedDirectory()
        Directory containing output of tests where we fail to generate golden output with Hive.

      • outputDirectories

        public scala.collection.Seq<java.io.File> outputDirectories()
        All directories that contain per-query output files

      • nonDeterministicLineIndicators

        public scala.collection.Seq<String> nonDeterministicLineIndicators()
